Sadly only spent about 15 minutes at the top here. There was no shelter from the heat, except inside the small shop. The temperature that day 36 %degrees, with the humidity at 78 % degrees. The view from top is just amazing, a photographers delight. We had booked with the entry ticket, a meal at the Rise restaurant, wrongly thinking it was the place we could see situated in the pictures at the very top, but, it was not to be. The restaurant is in the fact on the ground floor. The meal was ok though.
So it‚Äôs been there, done it, but would not choose to go back, unless much, much colder

My husband and I visited Marina Bay Sands while on holiday in Singapore. The view from the very top of the complex was breathtaking. We also saw all the beautiful gardens and trees all lit up at night. Spectacular show full of color.Definitely would love to come back and spend more time walking through the garden domes which we didn't get a chance too. Such a beautiful place to visit and stay.

We traveled on business so time was limited but the skypark is a fabulous place to enjoy the day around a pool to cool off in while enjoying cocktails and the awesome view of the city skyline. A worthwhile visit.
This is the reason to stay at the hotel. It's crowded so go early, but once in place you can order drinks and food. Probably the most spectacular pool in the world.

One time experience! Huge infinity pool with a beautiful view. There is a service to the pool and it is great. Fair prices and pretty decent menu. Have had the angus burger and the toasted ham sandwich and it was very good. The cocktails were ok. On the other side there is a jacuzzi also with a great view to the gardens. Very recommended!
Amazing sunset! You can enjoy a drink on the rooftop and watch the sunset then tou can go downstairs to see the water and light show
Great picturesque place. Better to visit at dusk so u can get a daytime and night time view . It‚Äôs beautiful when lit up.

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely view, but long wait for the elevator when leaving
REVIEW_BODY:
This is a landmark destination and it attracts lots of tourists and visitors. I‚Äôd paid $22, on a Thursday evening, which is like a cover charge to Ce la Vi bar & restaurant on 57th floor.

It was a cloudy day so I didn‚Äôt get to see the beautiful sunset. The sky was somewhat light orangy and pinkish. Nevertheless, a panoramic view of the city and Marina Bay.

From the 57th floor I went down to 56th floor Observation Deck for another look. That was a mistake, as the queue for the down elevator was about half an hour. Thank goodness the guests were all very patient and the queue moved in a orderly manner.
A must visit. The view from roof bars are super cool. The buildings are totally unique and a landmark in Singapore.

The Marina Bay Sands Sky Park Infinity Pool is phenomenal. An absolute must experience while staying at the hotel. Poolside service is great! But, get there early to get your lounge chair. Bring lots of sunscreen!

Busy busy lobby before you go up in the lift.
Nowhere to sit out on the observation deck...obviously want you to pay the money and get down quickly!
Yes great views but wouldn‚Äôt bother again

The View is fantastic from here... You can nearly see what they are eating in Batam Indonesia. The Ambience is lovely. One of the best Man made view in the world. You are nearly eye to eye with the pilots in the passing Airplanes but they don't have a Swimming pool on board.
We paid $20 per person to visit the Skypark and although there is a good view unless you are an hotel guest you are restricted to going to the top. A waste of money.

Visited this hotel to check it out before booking, mainly due to Crazy Rich Asians Movie!!! Thank goodness I did. There is an observation deck and the Ce La Vie bar that is open to anyone for about $22. Unfortunately if you are using the pool you‚Äôre looked over - like you‚Äôre in a zoo and the foyers are busy with tourists (yes like me) having a look. For such an expensive room rate I‚Äôd preferably choose the Raffles for the heritage or for a better overall experience the Sofitel City Centre Club Room and just visit the Marina Bay to have a look see. Hint : don‚Äôt pay for the observation deck, pay for the Ce La Vie bar and you get a drink as well!!!!
Marvellous view over Singapore with a nice cocktail or beer in you hand. The pool is absolutely amazing, unfortunately only for hotel guest but to see it is already an attraction. Must see!!

The Marina Bay Sands Skypark is a little hard to miss. A huge part of the Singapore sky line and something you have to visit.
Tickets are available online, and it is easy to get to.
A quick elevator ride and you come out to an incredible view of the Singapore harbour.
All of the key landmarks of Singapore are laid out before you, the Singapore Flyer, the Art Centre, the Merlion and much more.
If you are a guest of the hotel (unfortunately we weren‚Äôt) you can sit in the infinity pool and soak up the view. Otherwise spend some time walking around the observation deck, read the information boards dotted around to find out more about each of the landmarks.
Once you have had your fill of the view, there is plenty more to see with the Cloud Garden and Flower Garden at the base, as well as the rest of the beautiful gardens in the area.
Must do.....

REVIEW_TITLE: Vegan options on the bar Ce la vie
REVIEW_BODY: Enjoy the great view day and night. Can with pleasure order vegan and vegetarian meal. Staff is very friendly.

REVIEW_TITLE: Awesome views from the observation deck
REVIEW_BODY: You must take a visit and look at the views from the top of the tower, simply awesome. You can see for miles, it looks different at night when everything lights up.
Well worth travelling up the 54 floors to this for the views on a clear day, but public access is limited up the top, hotel guests have an extensive area and infinity pool

In Singapore there is much to see and of course the wonderful Marina Bay Sands Hotel looms majestically and somehow creeps into many photographs while on the ground. We were curious enough to pay the dollars to visit the Skypark but opted instead for the extra floor where we could have a drink and take in the views. It was crowded, drinks a little pricey, but certainly worthwhile for wonderful views though one had to edge around a bit see them. The Skypark deck allows more freedom of movement but then there is no place to sit. Seating only in the bar the next floor up with costs more. While up there I wished I was on the Skypark deck itself as one could move around freely while we were pretty squashed up against crowded tables on the upper level.

Infinity pool is awesome, however is cold up there due to strong wind. View is indeed incredible , lots of tourists at the edge of the pool getting a instagrammable shot, beware not to drop your camera in the water!
As I am so scared of heights this was a challenge, but one worth taking. Marvel at this amazing piece of architecture and love the incredible view!

REVIEW_TITLE: Like ants on top of a ant hill.
REVIEW_BODY: The size from the the ground view looking up, then when you go through the inside of the building you get to know how an ant may feel in side it‚Äôs nest. On top of Marina Bay you get that ant feeling again looking down from its ant hill.

We went up to the observation deck to see the view and were not disappointed. We stayed until after dark to watch the lights at the Gardens By the Bay. It was a great vantage point, even if we were too far away to hear the music. I wish we had gone later because once up there, there isnt much to really do but wait for sunset. However we got some great pictures!!!!

The pool is amazing and frustrating in equal measure. It's great to swim in, if only you could avoid the people wandering around taking selfies.

The views over the city from the pool are great. The views over the Gardens by the Bay and the harbour are lovely, although you have to look through glass.

There are not sufficient loungers by the pool, but if you go into the gardens section, there are more loungers set among trees and plants and it's much quieter there

Wednesday 23rd October and we were on our way to the Sands Skypark Observation Deck.

The observation platform is on the 56th floor and is 12,400 metres high and is located on the rooftop of one of the most recognisable and iconic buildings on Singapore's skyline.

The ticket price was 23$SD, however, when purchasing our ticket we received a 15% discount because we were travelling with Singapore Airlines. The actual ticket price was 19.55 $SD, roughly ¬£11 each.

There was no time limit to the length of stay up on the platform, we spend roughly 1 hour up there.

From the observation deck it is possible to see the landmarks and places of interest in Singapore. There were information boards around pointing out the sights. We were able to see, Singapore Flyer, Supertree Grove,The Quays, Science Museum, Merlion and so much more.

While on the platform it was possible to climb the steps to the 57 floor for a brief higher vista. This floor had bar, restaurant and swimming pool, this was for the Sands Hotel guests and those that purchased the package. For us access to the viewing platform was good enough. There was a kiosk there which was charging 4$SD about ¬£2.30 for a can of Coke Cola.

A part from walking around admiring the views there isn't much else to do up there. It is not possible to walk all the way around the observation deck as it did not go all the way around.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good view, just WAY too many people. For the gram, nothing much else.
REVIEW_BODY: It's a good view, but there are plenty of tall buildings with bars nearby. Personally, I didn't fancy the crowds vying for pictures when the bar is more comfortable and less crowded for the price of a drink.
You can pay $20 each to go to viewing platform or you can go one story higher for free and spend your $20, on food/drink and enjoy the free view. Enter lift from Tower two.

Must visit
Go there whatever it cost for you
Try it to have unforgettable emotions and impressions!
Great views!

This place offers a great view of Singapore. We went here at night right after the light show at Gardens by the bay. This place is not for those with fear of heights. This is another check on my bucket list.
The vibe here is cool and you can see the whole city from here.It is a beautiful experience to be on sky park
Amazing view from the 56th floor. There is also a restaurant in the viewing area which you can visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Well worth the money and time to visit to access the viewing deck
REVIEW_BODY: Great views in the evening and enjoyed an ice cream while taking in the scenery. Singapore really is beautiful with amazing architecture and skyline at night.

One of the more beautiful place to go in Singapore, with nice view, service and romantic disposal!
Well worth the stay at the hotel, with THE amazing swimming pool!!

The Marina Bay Sands is icon and can be seen from many places in Singapore. The building is beautiful and the admission to the skypark is well worth it. You can see the beautiful marina and the gardens by the bay as well as the city. The Singapore Sling sold there is to die for.

Marina Bay Sands Skypark is a great spot for cocktails though it gets very busy. Warning - make sure you buy a ticket for the to level skypark on the same level as the Marina Bay Sands pool and not a ticket which only takes you to the viewing area. They won't refund the ticket if you inadvertently buy the wrong one which is easy to do as there is not good information explaining that different tickets for the different areas.

We didn't have time to see it at night so we went during the day. It was impressive but would have been spectacular to see in the evening with the lights on. Lots lifts but a nice place to walk around. We liked the Chinese garden too which had a little pocket of shade behind it to chill out and enjoy the scenary.

My wife booked this as a birthday treat and proved to be an excellent choice. Upgraded to de lux room FOC, wonderful views, and spacious. Infinity pool a must swim in. Menu up there very reasonable and varied. An unforgettable experience.

Great views over Singapore.

A must to visit in the evening.

Lovely atmosphere - great to have a drink and admire the views around you

REVIEW_TITLE: Why buy Skypark tickets when you can do it via Ce La Vie?
REVIEW_BODY:
We were advised not to buy Sky Park tickets but to instead each purchase a $22 drinks vouchers for the Ce La Vie bar.

Tickets can be purchased on the ground floor of tower 3, ticket includes entry to their bar on the 57th floor (one floor higher than the observation deck) and includes a drink up to the value of $22 (you can top this up if you wish).

We saw everything the Skypark ticket holders saw (great views), only difference was we paid slightly less and had a drink in the bar, no time limit and free to roam around the large bar area.

Views are great regardless but the Ce La Vie option seems like a better way to do it!
The view is fantastic! There is a bar and restaurant at the top where you can buy refreshments. I watched the Marina Bay light show but also the Supertree Grove light display from the top.

Take in winning views of the city skyline and beyond on the Sands SkyPark Observation Deck..

Located 57 storeys up from the heart of the Marina Bay area, the Sands SkyPark Observation Deck boasts scenic views of the panoramic vistas of Marina Bay and Singapore‚Äôs world-class cityscape. Take in a bird‚Äôs-eye view of Gardens by the Bay and the impressive Supertree Grove, or admire the sea view that stretches from Marina South Pier to the Singapore Strait.

From above, try your hand at spotting Singapore‚Äôs iconic landmarks. Look out for the capsules on the Singapore Flyer and the durian-shaped domes of the Esplanade ‚Äì or the Merlion statue, another major tourist attraction in Singapore. Be sure to also keep an eye out for the orange-tiled roofs of the shophouses along the Singapore River.

REVIEW_TITLE: A Must See Location for Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: It's worth to take a look of thhis site as you can oversee the whole Singapore on top of the Sands. With building descriptions, you can know more about Singapore before you go to visit any interesting venue.
What a fantastic place to have a drink and enjoy great city and bay garden views. If you are staying at the hotel and want to enjoy the infinity pool, the end closest to the sky park is adults only

Located on 57th floor of Marina Bay Sands Hotel and lift lobby from tower 3. Fees are chargeable to visitors but free for hotel guest. You get to see 325 deg view of Singapore skyline. Beautiful view from above . The sky deck has 2 levels and these ends the boat like shape of the 3 towers. Enjoy the sunset here. The views are different during the day and pretty lights at night. It is a must thing to do when you visit Singapore. Great place to hang out.
Awesome rooftop boosting an infinity pool overlooking the Singapore river and skyline. Upper class ambience with good food and great service staff.
You have to be a guest at the hotel to enter the pool area but you can visit the top floor, have a drink at the bar and take in the most amazing views. Well worth a visit!

A trip to Singapore is not complete until you've been to marina bay.
Mind you..... having seen it I don't wish to stay there. It was pretty packed and not exclusive as I thought.
But the construction of marina bay really is spectacular in every way!
We made our way up to the top of the Skypark to grab a quick view of the impressive city of Singapore. My only gripe is that the Sands is such a marvel of a building, that you couldn't see it too!

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the must-see places in the world
REVIEW_BODY: As an engineer I have highest respect for people designing, building and operating such a remarkable place. Breathtaking indeed.

REVIEW_TITLE: Commanding view of Singapore from here, but little else to do.
REVIEW_BODY: Showers briefly threatened to close this attraction 56 floors up from the ground.The main thrust out the hotel is the Casino, hence the name Sands.The panoramic aspect of the Skypark is unparalleled , and makes for excellent Instagram selfies. There is little else there, apart from a fairly ramshackle shop.The restaurants and the infinity pool are out of bounds, but some paying guests in white bathing robes ventured down to enjoy the views .
It is A Good Photo Spot and From here you can have a look of full Singapore. Best time to Visit is in the Evening Around 18.00 - 20.00

Not much to say views where awsome looking over the habour and gardens by the bay. No access to pool area which is reserved for hotel guess. Bit pricey for the view no seatting or shelter from the hot sun and small food stand, with over priced drinks didnt even stay 15 minutes before I was bored and sun was hot. View was worth it but would only recommend if its a short trip last minute option to explore Singapore at its best

Great view but that was about it. Was not allowed in the bar as only hotel guests. No where to sit and absorb. Went during the day left after 20 mins. Might try later at night to see if any better. A tick off the list though.

View is nice. When you stand at Skypark observation deck, you can have overall view of Singapore, from Marina Bay, Garden By the Bay, Ferris wheel until Singapore‚Äôs port. At 9 p.m, standing at Skypark, you can see whole of musical fountain show is performed at Marina Bay. It‚Äôs very nice. But there is one thing that i feel unhappy at here. Gate pass price is expensive, about 25 SGD for one person but they don‚Äôt offer any complimentary drink, even one simple and cheap kind of drinks is mineral water. And they don‚Äôt have any free chair for you can sit. You must sit on the floor if you don‚Äôt want to stand for a long time. If you want to sit on chair, you must come in the restaurant there and pay for drinks. Price of drinks in this restaurant is more expensive than the price at the ground around Marina Bay Sand Hotel about four times. But you want to have an overall view of Singapore, especially Marina Bay, you should come here.
Definitely worth a visit! View is spectacular & the pool is gorgeous. Be prepared to wait in line if you visit in the evening.

The Skypark offers a great view of the CBD of Singapore on one side and Gardens by the Bay on the other side.

Spectacular!

Got to visit a movie set!
Greats views of the city. Bit disappointing that you are only able to see one end as the other end for hotel guests.
But worth the visit.
Amazing engineering. WOW.
The entire building is worth a look

This was an amazing experience for us on the first day in Singapore. We went just after sunset to enjoy the amazing view. It wasn‚Äôt too busy on a Sunday evening and I would highly recommend buying tickets online in advance for busier times. The queue was well managed and we spent about 45 minutes enjoying the view. You can take nice panoramic images from the elevated top platform which can get a bit more crwoded than the other level. Would recommend anyone to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must go - Best View of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: I must say as a Singaporean, this is a must see for all tourists and locals. You get to see the most important areas in Singapore and feel the cool mist.
Singapore is a small country so this is a must-visit. You can find many famous things here: stores, restaurants, office,.. The skypark was great.

we took a loft from the marina bay sands to reach the 56th floor which has the skydeck.it is very beautiful and all the pictures you take here will be excellent.There is a shopping mall below and some souvenir shop here.also the infinity pool area can be seen from here

This masterpiece of engineering gives fantastic views of the whole of Singapore and is well worth a visit. The views are breathtaking but be careful!!!

There are different ticket options so decide what you really want. I.e if you only want to take fantastic photos and get a clear view of the city then get a ticket for the observation platform.

If you simply want to see the views, have a drink and/or something to eat then get the free drink ticket......this does not allow you on the observation platform!!!!

You can obviously still take some good photos from the restaurant areas but they are limited by the deck and it‚Äôs hand railing in some areas as this area is higher and in the middle of the deck.

Lots of areas such as the infinity pool are also only for hotel guests so dont expect to have a swim!

If you're a tourist looking to do touristy things, this is your place, but for a local it's overpriced and it doesn't really give you an amazing experience. Tried it when I first moved here, wouldn't do it again. (The view from the walkway by the Louis vuitton store is practically the same)
What an amazing place to visit. Up on 56th floor the sights are spectacular. There is the Infinity pool on top of three towers that is shaped like a high boat and it is very atmospheric.

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent walk even in the heat
REVIEW_BODY: It took us about two hours to walk around the waterfront. Make sure you stop by the Fullerton Hotel and see the beautiful inside. They also have a pricey buffet. Also check out the business building. There are beautiful pieces of art in the lobby see the photographs below. In the shopping mall, on the second floor, where the far end, you can find the Superheroes Restaurant. We didn‚Äôt eat there because it was rather pricey. But the models of the DC comics Superheroes are cool for a photograph.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must do trip when in Signapore
REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a visit gives you great views of Signapore. Well worth the money a surreal experience and very easy once at hotel.

Enjoying four days at the MBS Roof Top swimming pool and spa‚Äôz ... Excellent place to Chill out.. Exotic people watching!! Everyone seems to be having the Swim of a Lifetime!! It‚Äôs also a fantastic venue to watch the evening Sunsets!! The food and drinks service is top notch and very professional.. Happy Swimming!! James B . Oregon USA

REVIEW_TITLE: Interesting overview of Singapore, great photo op
REVIEW_BODY:
This is NOT a way to get access to the infinity pools shown in all the promotions - the pool is for hotel guests only. However the skypark has a large two story observation deck on the end that curves around so you can see the city, harbor, and gardens by the bay. The roughly s$20 fee seems a little high, but we didn't feel as ripped off as we did in the ArtScience museum.

The advance ticket sellers gave the impression you would be limited to a specific entry and exit time, herded as a group, and it would probably sell out. When I asked for the senior discount they referred me directly to the hotel, I got the discount, there were no waiting lines, and we were not limited to the time we were there.

Visited mid morning, not busy no queue and gas lift to ourselves. Entry through Tower 3. Views from top were quite good. Not many places to sit and very little shade. Small kiosk selling drinks and snacks. Also a bar that we did not try. It was expensive for what it was, but sure great at night

I think this is a rip off - I have been up this previously for the views - and it was free. Now you pay $22 SNG $ but recieve a free drink at the top for the same value. I just think its a bit naughty. Would not do it again - or stay at the hotel - reception is like Euston Station at peak hour - see it but steer clear.
the view is amazing and the lights of the city make it very romantic and special. Although it is a very busy place, it is just magical
We watched the NDP Preview at the skypark and it was sooo awesome! Totally worth it. Seeing the Singapore Skyline is also great.

At the basement of the hotel you can buy the tickets on automatic machines. In can you flew to Singapore on Singapore Airlines you will get an extra discount. There is staff at the basement that can help you buying the tickets and getting your discount. The waiting time for the lift is not really long. Up there you have a Phantastin view at the Singapore skyline, the Merlion, the sea, the Singapore Flyer, Gardens at the Bay and more. The visit is certainly worthwhile.
Imaginary tour and a very informative experience. Well operated by ferry shuttles and the place imagining.

Although it is not a panoramic view you still can see a lot
It‚Äôs very hot during the day , so we enjoyed by the bar with good cocktails

56 stories up gives you a great view of the city and surrounds. 30 minutes on the roof is plenty, lots of good photo opportunities.

We went mid afternoon, no queue but was quite hot. I'm sure at night it would be quite spectacular.

We went to the Skypark for a cocktail to celebrate my 60th birthday. What a great experience! Amazing views and fantastic cocktails. The staff were so friendly and helpful. One of the staff took us to a great viewing spot and pointed out some of Singapores landmarks. The only odd thing is that the restrooms are one floor down so you have to get the lift to them. Many thanks for a wonderful afternoon.

It was a beautiful opportunity to see the laser lights from the skypark. Worth the money to go up and experience it. Definitely will return when I return to Singapore again. Singapore is a beautiful clean city.

There's no doubt about it, this has to be one of the most incredible engineering feats in the world. The amazing infinity pool with views that will blow your mind. We found 6 - 7am by far the best time to enjoy the pool and early morning views when it was quiet. During the day it was a no go zone for us as it was absolutely packed. But up to you how you want to enjoy this cool facility.

It‚Äôs about $20 US and worth it to catch the best views of Singapore. Can‚Äôt imagine anyone spending more than about 30 mins up there, as you have no access to restaurant or pool. Good for a quick view and get the layout of city. Would recommend from lobby area just booking a meal to one of the two restaurants, saving the entry fee on Skypark, and use that money to pay for food/drink. If I went back would do it that way instead.

Its truly wonderful. The Bay Sands itself i.e. the shopping mall is a huge one where one can spend the entire day or even 2 if you are a casino player...:) But the view from the top of the bay sands park is too good. If you visit the tower at around 6.30pm then you can witness the Sunset and watch both the light and water show from the roof top. (1 - Gardens by the bay show, 2 - fountain and laser show). In my opinion, its a must go place and should not be missed.
Must visiting place when you go to Singapore.Best views in the city, MUCH better than the Singapore Flyer

I love the Skypark though I‚Äôve been enough times that it isn‚Äôt quite so special now. You get great views of the city particularly at dusk when the lights come on in the city and on the ships offshore. There‚Äôs a bar and other drinks available though you no longer have the run of the deck. It beats The Wheel any day.

First thing first. It is not the cheapest but well worth the visit.

This is an open deck and there is also a restaurant and small cafe.

However almost 360 deg view of Singapore skyline and what a view.

You can see the river meandering along Spot the racetrack and Fullerton hotel. Then walk to the other side and see all the cargo ships and looking down you will find gardens by the bay. Absolutely amazing.

Well worth the price even though it is still very steep

Visited the place during holidays.

Entrance to the place is through basement of Tower 3 of the Marina Sands hotel

Queue as usual for the entrance.

Lifts are super fast and one reaches in just no time

View from top is fantabulous

Ideal towards the night time to see Singapore all decked up in lights
It is a must visit place. Beautiful place,colorful and u will love it. Try making this place while visiting Singapore.
Although the weather was quite hazy, we still had a great view. Great place for photo taking. worth going up to take a peek!
The attraction, like burj kalifa, has restricted accessibility for outsiders! Won‚Äôt take you to topmost level, the beautiful pictures of infinity pool can‚Äôt be taken as cant be accessed
Amazing view of Singapore! We had a wonderful time and enjoyed our time at the Skypark. I wish that we came back at night to see the night lights of Singapore.

Great view over Gardens by bay and city views. Top deck is ok but no seating apart from wooden deck to sit on. Restaurant & skydeck bar is for residents only. We paid for a frozen Singapore sling (slushy - in a plastic cup. Felt like a second class citizen!
Of course this is a architectural world wonder, hut you will pay for it. come for drinks and enjoy the view for a few hours.

You do not have to stay in the hotel to go up there. There is a bar that you can go. The view from there is amazing!
Observation Deck is over priced so you just go up to the bar and you can use $22 to your drink or food. Of course, lots of drinks are from 25$ and above, but then you only have to pay few more $.
It is higher than Observation deck and you can sit there.
All though, if rain, the place you can go will be limited. You can look out for the pool, but can not go in there, anyway, pool is crowded.

The view from the top of the sky park is honestly breathtaking! Admission was $30 SGD including a frozen Singapore sling which I found to be quite reasonable. There is a small souvenir shop up the top also if you would like to purchase something memorable. Little tip, the shirt designs in their shop are not available to purchase anywhere else. Take your time and enjoy the views while you‚Äôre up there! Admission is once per ticket. Highly recommend for a unique and incredible view of Singapore!
Totally amazing hotel, shopping centre and rooftop with fantastic views . . . a totally amazing place

If you ever visit Singapore you can not miss that!! The view is amazing from the top floor and of course the best time is to visit during the night where the city is light up.
There is no time limit and you can stay as much as you want. Also there is a mini bar where you can buy soft drinks or alcohol and to enjoy the view.

I've never left a trip advisor review before but felt the Marina Bay Skypark observation deck was very overpriced at $30. This included a frozen Singapore Sling. Normally $23 without.
When you get up to the deck your not allowed in the bar only for people staying in the hotel.
The customer service at the shop where you get a frozen drink was dreadful. The person running it could not even be bothered to get off his phone but I also noticed he was rude to the people behind us. There's no seating or shade.
If you going to Singapore then you must spend 20 USD to visit this place. Panoramic view of Singapore can be see specially in night after sunset. Do check their list of Do's and Don'ts.

Easy up and easy down. It was a nice trip up to level 56. Wasn't too expensive either. The view is pretty awesome. I caught an lightning storm on my camera the night I went up. Didn't try the bar or restaurant so don't know if they change the experience. Did get to view the Gardens by the Bay show but that would have been better on ground level. Overall a very good excursion to take.

Before anything, the ideal time is to reach extremely fresh at about 7 pm and stay there till after sunset. What I did was reach at 1815 after walking some 14 kms. So by the time I was there, I was smashed. I don‚Äôt have much words but I do have some photographs.
Yes it was GP week, yes it was expensive to visit teh actual bar ( Ce La Vie) but so well worth it - DO IT, you won't be disapointed!

Visited the SkyPark with colleagues who hadn't been before.

At the Marina Bay Sands there are two ways to vist the roof of the hotel. There is the SkyPark and there is also the SkyBar.

You have to pay for admission to the SkyBar but it is redeemable against the cost of drinks in the bar. Whilst expensive it means the entrance is effectively free.

The views are exceptional and very nearly as good as the observation deck except that there is limited access to the edge of the platform.

The tickets to the observation deck are quite pricey for what you get. You stand in line and take and elevator up. You are in the top corner of the deck. You get some nice sites and can take some pictures but I was done in under ten minutes. And then down and out. I wouldn't do it again.

It was certainly worth the experience, but we would have enjoyed being able to see more of the 57th floor - not just one end. Unfortunately it was an unhealthy air day and the visibility wasn't very good for photos and the particulates in the air made my skin itch and probably wasn't great for my lungs either, but this was our first visit to Singapore so we couldn't miss the opportunity to check out the Skypark. The hotel and shops are certainly worth seeing.

We spent the full day by the pool on the roof,the food and drinks were very good value for Singapore.When lights come on over city it looks amazing and just get into the hot tub and relax 57 floors in the air.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place for a drink and a meal.
REVIEW_BODY: Well worth going up to the 57th floor and having a drink and / or meal outside. Views are excellent and as it gets dark the lights coming on across Singapore add to the atmosphere. Simple food, but freshly prepared and well presented. A great experience.
Far from the traffic and crowd with the family decided to spend lot of time enjoying this unique breathtaking location, relaxing and having fun! Don‚Äôt miss it!

The hotel provides is a truly spectacular part of the Singapore skyline. The purchase of tickets to the Skypark is easy and there are concessions available. However, although the views up there are stunning with lots of photo opportunities, the actual space you are allowed to go is very limited. There‚Äôs a great looking bar up some steps on raised platform but unfortunately you can‚Äôt access it unless you are a hotel guest. A bit of a tease really. Enjoyed the views, disappointed with the limited access.
View is amazing. Large deck, can get busy. Definitely worth a visit. There is a cafe/souvenir shop there as well.
Climate was mild and slightly humid, the pool and surroundings design was great, you could relax and watch from above the city It was really great

REVIEW_TITLE: Views of Singapore from this vantage point
REVIEW_BODY: Top spot to see a lot of Singapores attractions from high up. For us it was unfortunate that the city was covered in haze but I'm sure it's a good view more often than not.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see for anyone visiting Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The view is absolutely amazing and I am not sure that it could be beaten to be honest. If you are a hotel guest you have got to try the infinity pool too.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful views rip you off with your drinks.
REVIEW_BODY: Buy the pass to go up the Sky deck and turn left! No one tells you this or directs you when you get up there. The view is amazing. Take a lot of money! Drinks are super expensive and don‚Äôt include tax or a tip in the drinks menu.
The views from here and view of the water and light show in the bay make an evening visit a must in this fabulous city

We booked a combo package for the observation deck and dinner in RISE. The package was worth it, dinner was great and it was really easy to book and organise.
The view however, stole the show! Looking across the city it really is the most beautiful cityscape. We went up at dusk so we saw the views in the day and at night. I would say it‚Äôs far more beautiful at night if you have to make a choice. There weren‚Äôt any queues to get up although queues coming down were longer immediately after the light show which is at 8pm.

The view was good but it stops there , no seating very very crowded specially at night when the lights come on. Had a bad experience with the ticket satff who were rude. Not worth the cost of the ticket when there are other places worth seeing.
Great view of the city. And quite windy up there. I went upto the 56th floor. There are a few restaurants there. Needless to say they are extremely pricy.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best moments of our trip
REVIEW_BODY: Definitely one of the biggest highlights of our trip. The views (despite Singapore being shrouded in the haze which has blanketed much of South East Asia of late) were spectacular. Nothing more romantic or memorable than watching the sun set over Singapore, frozen Singapore Sling in hand, with your loved one and see the lights of the city glow.
This is an amazing place!!! The observation deck is great with amazing views, the infinity pool - no words!!! Drinks ok and the shops are great!! It‚Äôs a must visit.

We had a bit of a smoggy day but view was incredible. I am afraid of heights but had to do this. We got our tickets quickly at the desk and the wait to go up was not that long.

The only thing that surprised me was the flooring up at the viewing deck. It looks abit worn and made me a bit cautious. I would think for the amount of visitors and revenue this brings in that the floor would look better maintained.

Stayed at Marina bay sands for one night and enjoyed the views from the skypark then enjoyed a cocktail at the bar. The skypark is great for your special pictures but found the guy who served us at the bar uninterested and quite rude so he unfortunately spoiled the end of our evening...quite unusual as most staff were lovely.
don't go there to swim... just go to take a selfie or photograph of the view....the views are stunning

The skypark is a very limited walk way at the far end of the MBS rooftop terrace. It has no seats, a very small coffeeshop (no seats!) and good views. But you can get good views anywhere without paying $23 each.

I am sure the MBS hotel is great if you can walk in the gardens, visit the pool, have a nice drink, have a seat and enjoy the view. But you can't do that at the skypark, you just walk around a wooden walkway and take a few pictures before descending 20 mins later.
marina bay sands park is singapores one of the best park i ever seen such a lovely park with skyline combinationi love it and great feelingthere.

We visited recently and stayed up there no longer than 5 minutes. The view is beautiful but there is nowhere to sit, very little shade and the sign that points to the restaurant is worthless when the restaurant is for hotel patrons only.
This is an amazing place to see marina bay and beyond but we visited on a clear day not sure what the view is like on one of Singapore‚Äôs misty days

Well worth the entry price
Stunning views of Singapore, make sure to take photos
We went at teatime and stayed till dark so we saw the garden by the bay come alight to music as well as the water / laser show opposite sides (ok but don‚Äôt plan a separate visit to this)

Observation deck at 57th floor of iconic Marina bay sand hotel,have amazing view of Singapore. We visited last 1st week of September,as it was off season and weekday so no rush,didnt have to wait for a minute till lift,only few minutes for lift.Ticket price is 23 SGD but on different apps its less,i bought from Klook and it cost 21 SGD plus a limo bubble tea.The mail from Klook is itself a ticket which can be directly scan at turnstile We reached top around 6 pm and stayed there tilk 8 pm,got chance to view both during light and after sunset. Views were majestic. Worth visit in Singapore.

So you get herded up there in a cramped lift. Then when there you can only have a drink
Standing up. They then want to charge 80 dollars for a photo. Staff that I spoke to were unfriendly and should not work in that environment very disappointed and not typical Singapore. Waste of time and money

If you come to Singapore you will definitely visit Marina Bay Sands.
The views from the top are stunning.
Vist as the sun is going down and watch the light show at 7.45 or 8.45 at the gardens and then watch the light show on the harbour side of the building to watch the light show at 9 pm.
Birds eye view of the country in the most alive scene in the country... Definitely a one of a kind experience .

Glad we did this as we got a great view of the F1 track. Nice to be able to walk through the whole hotel which has the feel of Las Vegas. There are plenty of signs directing you to the Sky Garden. You pay $25 per person or $32 if you want a small Singapore Sling slush puppy. You go up in a lift, get you drink and look out. You can stay as long as you like but there is no seating. You can not use access the proper bar or pool. In fact you can‚Äôt really see the famous pool. You are only allowed on the viewing platform at the tip of the roof. There is a bar and gift stand you can access. We had hoped to see a light show but it had been cancelled because of the Grand Prix, I think that should have been communicated at the ticket office.

We decided to have a lunch break whilst visiting the Gardens by the Bay and this was a perfect venue, great views, lunch and drinks were excellent, especially as the cost of entry covers your first drink. A place not to be missed on a trip to Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great view. Don‚Äôt miss it or you‚Äôll regret it
REVIEW_BODY: If you made it to Singapore already, do what it takes to get up there and enjoy the view (both the city and sea views). Missing it will make it you regret it forever...

We went to ce la vi bar, my girfriend went into the bar for free and I had to pay 28 singapore dollar, and both got a drink with the entry tickets. The view is amazing, even with the haze that these days singapore has had.

If you choose to just visit a restaurant up on the sky park, you don‚Äôt need to pay the extra fee, but you can not get the best view. To enjoy a perfect view and walk you need to invest 23S$, which is quite ok to enjoy the stunning view from the rooftop. To enjoy the pool, you need to be a hotel guest. But there are some restaurants, which do offer great food plus a beautiful view.
From here to can over watch the whole city. Several nice bars on top to get some drinks and foods. But even more expensive than the rest of Singapore.

The Skypark at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel is worthy of the hype circulating the globe. To start, the hotel itself is stunning, impeccably clean, offers industry leading service, and everything one would expect from a world class hotel.

The pool and clubs become overrun by club-goers and swimmers later in the day and into the evening.

We found the very best time to enjoy the views and a splash was right when the pool opens st 6am. And since we had arrived the previous night after 20 hours of air travel, we were happy to open the pool after a nice night‚Äôs rest.

The views of the city and the bay are spectacular. A great place to escape, watch the sun rise and see the city awaken.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth doing but a slight disappointment
REVIEW_BODY: We were very excited to get to the top of the Marina Bay Sands hotel. We'd seen photographs and read about the infinity pool and although we knew we wouldn't be able to swim in the pool (that privilege is reserved for residents) we were looking forward to seeing it up close. The lift to the top takes you up one side of the hotel and it is almost impossible to get a view of the pool. However, there are still some very impressive views from the top and I'd still recommend doing this. That said I actually thought the Marina Bay Sands hotel was more impressive from the ground. It is a spectacular structure.

It's a bonus to be a Marina Bay Sands hotel guest, just take your room card and go up in the fast elevator. The off-the-street price is quite expensive. The view is amazing, especially at night, and floating in the infinity pool is a unique experience, definitely worth a photo. There's more than enough pool-side loungers to relax on. The restaurant is great too, and sipping your cocktail al fresco on the deck is fabulous, breathtaking at night.

REVIEW_TITLE: Massively overpriced trip to the very end bit of the roof
REVIEW_BODY: Okay, if you want a really high view go and do this, but you DON'T get to visit the whole 'skypark', just a small end deck area (the bow of the ship). That's it. simple. $23 each for that and you might be happy. Whatever you do don't turn it into $73 by adding the photo. Seriously - I left after 10 minutes. If I had to pay for my family (4) to go up at that price I would have felt very annoyed once arriving and seeing what little you get to see. Small gift kiosk and a restaurant. And a large empty deck. And an exit.

One of the must visit place in singapore if you want to enjoy breathtaking views of singapore skyline and the nice lighting in the evening of the city. one can enjoy free light and sound show also if visiting in evening close to the timing of the show.
Was there to enjoy the view. Many people - it depends on what season. Overall, everything is nice everywhere.

Great view of the city but limited to where you can go (only one end) and there is nowhere to sit and relax to take in the view or have a coffee etc. Would be nicer if there was a cafe/coffee shop and seating available.

REVIEW_TITLE: Waste of money as Skypark Swimming pool is not open for Visitors
REVIEW_BODY: Waste of money as Skypark Swimming pool is not open for Visitors. Its at the top of building from where you can see entire Singapore. The same experience you can get by taking ride in singapore flyer

REVIEW_TITLE: Astounding architecture and views to match
REVIEW_BODY: The hotel and platforms looked impressive from the distance and even more so up close. The tour ticket took us to the 56th floor viewing area via an elevator that was so fast and rapid, you hardly feel it moving. The nighttime views from above provided a nice city scape view accentuated by the city lights. The distant view of the cargo ships parked in the bay seemed so peaceful. Tip: if you want to take a selfie at night, use one of the wall mounted lights to illuminate your face while capturing the night view of the city.
It was a good experience.Better to go around 5 pm ; Then you can see stunning views.This place is amazing.You can see whole Songapore from the top of Marina bay sands.We will visit again surely.

A must when in Singapore. Take the lift to the top of the world, and on a clear day you can see forever...
Thoroughly breathtaking...

Definitely an awesome place, beautiful view!
You can see everything from upthere, if you have the chance to go for sure is a must on your list!
Possibly a must do if you want views & photos, but a little overpriced, especially if you add the $50 photo, however I‚Äôd still recommend it if you don‚Äôt mind crowds & heights

The Marina Bay Sands Hotel has been a staple of the Singapore skyline since its opening. The MBS Skypark located on the 57th floor has restaurants and an infinity pool which stretches across the towers. The Skypark has a 360 view which also cover the Gardens by the Bay. It's a great way to enjoy the view while sipping a nice cocktail from the adjacent bar.

REVIEW_TITLE: Free for guests of the hotel, and so spectacular
REVIEW_BODY: WOW, what a pool. I am sure this is the most photographed place in Singapore, maybe the whole world... and its so much fun swimming 57 floors up

I‚Äôm glad I did this, it was a great view. I don‚Äôt know that I would go more than one time though. The bar was a little crowded but it was right around sunset so that is to be expected. We did have to wait in line very long for a ticket and once we got up the elevator there wasn‚Äôt any problem getting to a place with a view of the city or bay.

We decided to visit this place, it costs 23 SD per person. The staff were friendly and is reasonably easy to find the entrance which you need to go down the escalator outside the tower.

When you buy your ticket you walk round and you have to get your picture taken which you can get later a copy later on before you get in the lift on the way down from the sky deck.

You are only allowed around a small part of the deck as the restaurant and pool area are only for hotel guests. The views are great from the deck but there isn't much else to do up there. It is greatly overpriced for the experience and is something like 50 SD just for the photo on its own or 80 SD if you want the key ring and something else. The views are good but don't expect much for your money. There isn't a time limit but with nothing to do other than admire the views and sit on the floor in the shade (which a sign says your not allowed to sit on floor). If you have the money and want to say you have been there then go for it otherwise don't bother as not worth the money
Had a great time marina Bay and the view at the infinity pool was simply gorgeous. Will come back soon.
This really is a special hotel. The view from the Skypark is spectacular. A great photo opportunity.

This is one place you should not miss. Reach by evening so you can see the daylight views as well as city lit up dusk. It‚Äôs easily reachable and ticket pricing is justified. One can also see the laser show at Bayfront

Marina Bay Sands Skypark is on top of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. The views are absolutely awesome. You can see over to Indonesia and Malaysia.
There are many a view to take pictures of. Although initially I thought you could swim in the worlds highest infinity pool, I was wrong. That is a separate part of the roof top and is only available to use if you are a Hotel guest.
There is merchandise and food/drinks available in the Skypark. The elevator is incredible. It takes approx 30 seconds to go up the 57 floors to the roof. They also take your photo before you go up so this is an option to purchase.

Marina Bay Sands Skypark offers the greatest view of the Ocean, the bay, Gardens By the Bay and the City of Singapore. Situated at the Marina Sands Bay the Boat-shaped park and the viewing deck, you can have the best view of Singapore's F1 track as well.
Swimming pool and restaurant also there giving an infinity view of modern Singapore.
This is a must visit for all the travellers. Gives excellent view from the top. Bought 'shot glass' souvenir from theta, which can be avoided as it sells for double the price.

If you are just paying to go up and have a look you won‚Äôt see the image of the pool as this is for hotel guests only. You will get a nice view over Singas which will cost you $23 SD for the privilege.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must stay at MBS hotel just to soak in this delightful view from the regions most famous infinity pool!
REVIEW_BODY: Is it crowded. Yes it can be. However not everyone wades to infinity side of pool and stay there for two hours from the best time of the day to soak in an awesome view of the city skyline and Bay between 6pm to nearly 8pm. If you stay at this hotel but do not find time to take a quick plunge, it‚Äôs a real pity as I strongly believe a huge part of your hotel bill is incorporated here. We stayed in a high floor VIP room with balcony and a view on the opposite side, the entire Gardens by the Bay. Good news is you can catch both of these views from the top floor pool area. There‚Äôs a laser light show around 8pm but not much to appreciate as it‚Äôs better viewed from opposite side of the hotel across the Bay. After your pool experience ending 7pm ish, head opposite to Gluttons corner or MakanSutra if you wish to avoid the expensive MBS restaurants, some over rated. From there, aside to catching the laser show, you get to experience all the common famous local cuisine from one place with multiple food hawkers, Bring your own napkins as it‚Äôs not a napkin friendly place for the OCD types!:) There is a hidden rest room at MakanSutra where you could also wash your hands after indulging with crabs and other dishes but you have to ask one of the stall owners to know that little small ‚Äúalley‚Äù to the rest rooms.

Pros
Awesome infinity pool at 50th floor. Nice view at day and night.

Cons
Over crowded. Can't really swim around
It was an amazing view of singapore and a glance of MBS infinity pool. We really had fun since it was not crowded by the time of our visit.

This cannot be explained, one must experience it by oneself. All I can say, is that it is breathtaking feeling to be on top of Singapore's most fancy hotel complex. The price is not that high compared to the experience (hotel guests have free entry).

The Skypark at MBS is absolutely incredible. Amazing bars and food with Spago and Lavo, not to mention one of the best poolside views in the world. Worth the stay the MBS just to see the infinity pool. No brainer and worth the money!

We wanted to visit the observation deck after seeing it on BBC's race across the world. The views were not to disappoint with clear panoramic views over the city. It's a definite must see place for tourists with information boards at each point describing the buildings at view point.

Costs for the view but an absolute must do in Singapore . The design of this building is unbelievable and to see the 360 view of singapore is amazing especially the gradens at night and the ships in the harbour

this place is only for hotel guests. one can enjoy sunrise and sunset. it is crowded during evening time in pool area. there is also bar and restaurant on the top. people who want to experience view from marina bay sands can buy obeservation deck ticket where you can spend few hours.

It has the most amazing views of the city & beyond. The infinity pools are amazing. Everyone is taking selfies!! There are bars, restaurants & you can look down on the Gardens By the Bay. It's another good spot to see the light show, from above!
Great view, not much else to do, so probably worth looking at... but soooo packed with squillions of kids

We had a family visit to this place in the evening. Lots of visitors could be seen taking pictures, some of them jogging also. Beautiful lights have been installed as those weren't there on our last visit. One could have cane juice, sweet corn and Thai tea etc. Many concert shows are happening there and we enjoyed one out of those. We reached both ways by taxi from Alexandra Road.
A must visit attraction in Singapore. Go before sunset to view the transition from day to night. Fantastic night scenery. Not to be missed.

REVIEW_TITLE: Would be a must visit attraction of South east Asia soon
REVIEW_BODY:
Magnificient looking building. And tallest to visit as a tourist. Expensive but worth spending those extra pennies.
Do not miss the light and water show in the evening.
Loved the entire marina bay ecosystem. everything was wonderful, right from food to the shopping malls to garden by the bay. All were great! highly recommended
Greatest view in Singapore recommended for sure. couldnt go to the infinity pool because I got the 20 dollar ticket but still worth it
Beautiful and nice place to stay and having a good time at skypark especially in the morning watching sunrise.

REVIEW_TITLE: Save your money for the Singapore Flyer.
REVIEW_BODY: After paying almost $50.00 we were surprised and disappointed to find we were unable to go onto the observation deck. With no acknowledgement from the bar staff after waiting for two minutes we took a couple of pics and left. Having been on the Flyer an hour earlier I would definitely reccomend it over the Marina Bay view. Mich better views and 100 times better service.

The Marina Bay Sands Skypark Observation Deck is a unique experience. Located in the Hotel, one can purchase a ticket for around S$23 (Online ticketing gets you cheaper or with a Singapore Airline ticket). You are transported to the 56th Floor on a Lift where you enter the open Observation Deck with a magnificent, panoramic view of the city with its skyscrapers, water bays, ships, Flyer, Gardens by the Bay etc. You can capture the memories with the professional photographers, if required. You can buy various types of Souvenirs from the Shops at the exit.

REVIEW_TITLE: if you have the time, just do it!
REVIEW_BODY: Yes it will cost you 23 S$, but the view is worth it. You can go all the way to the top of the Marina Bay Sands hotel and have a look over the sea, the city. Feel the sun, the wind and enjooy the view. I had this one on top of my list and I did not regret doing it. I would do it again in the evening to see it all by night.

I already knew before going that we wouldn't be able to access the pool, but wanted to be able to get a bite to eat and sit to take in the view. The board with the ticket prices said there was a cafe which sold light bites like sandwiches, so we paid the $23 to go up. We tried to go into the restaurant area but were told only hotel guests could access it. There was a very small stand on the deck itself which only sold drinks, icecream, nuts, and chips, and there were no seats and no shade to eat it in. It felt like a rip-off for $23 - we didn't do the Singapore flyer, but I'd suggest giving that a try instead.

Incredible views of Singapore CBD, Gardens By The Bay, Singapore Flyer etc. I went there at night and to see the city all lit up was truly amazing. Also saw the Garden Rhapsody show at Super tree grove and Spectra show at Marina Bay Sands from above. If you go at around sunset, you can get both day and night views.

This has to be one of the ‚Äòmust do‚Äô attractions in Singapore.
The views are breathtaking, and there can‚Äôt be a better place to have dinner or even a Singapore Sling.
Unfortunately we weren‚Äôt staying in this hotel, so we couldn‚Äôt use the infinite swimming pool, but were able to view it.
It would‚Äôve been amazing to be here during the F1 Grand Prix in a few weeks time, and view it from here.
I would definitely recommend visiting the Skypark, and if possible stay in the MBS hotel!
The view is not 360 degree and if you like a drink you can only get it from a stall while the caf√© is for hotel guests only.

REVIEW_TITLE: A beautiful location for a cocktail
REVIEW_BODY:
The cost of a cocktail came with magnificent views of Singapore.
We were able to see out in all directions, and relax in the lounges adjoining the bar area. Highly recommend this. Well worth the visit.

Attracted by the many positive feedbacks, we decided to visit the Marina Bay rooftop. Unfortunately it was a really disappointing experience. The pool cannot be even seen, the rooftop is very crowded and bad organized: few chairs, people who ‚Äúconquers‚Äù them holding the chairs for a long time, so that you cannot even take a decent picture of the view. Entrance is expensive (22 dollars), but drinks are even more, starting from 23 + taxes and services.
We really could not see anything. We expected more. Very very disappointing. Not recommend.

SD$23.00 each
Well worth the cost to have a spectacular view of Singapore city with a music and light show over the bay thrown in.
Warm night for a quiet beer while taking in the sites from above.

If you dont mind heights and appreciate good views this is worth a visit, if you just want to take pictures the skydeck itself is very cheap, prices go up if you want to visit the bar the next floor.
Unfortunately if you want to visit the pool and gardens you will need to book a night in one of the three towers hotel.

This is a must-do in Singapore. The views are excellent and you do get almost a 360 view of the city. The best time to come is just before sunset and if you are lucky with the clouds, you'll get to one of the best sunsets in Asia.

Great views of this amazing city. Very easy to access via the self service kiosk and all the staff we encountered were courteous and helpful. I think we'll go back on a night time visit before we go as this place is stunning at night even from walking around the esplanade.

Evening visit, to see the lights of Singapore and coloured fountain and supertree light displays. Amazing view of singapore at night but coloured light displays a bit disappointing - very far away. Very crowded on a Sunday evening an no seats.
The view is absolutely stunning. It is certainly a work of art. The way it has all been created.An absolute jewel.
We visited to see the views. We were fortunate enough to be there just before the gardens by the bay light show started. Really nice views. Would recommend.
Mesmerizing views from above! Nice place to watch the sunset over Singapore. The ticket counter was organised and the whole experience was enjoyable.
Perfect weather to visit Marina Bay stands and boating on lake / Ocean watching around was a great private tour

REVIEW_TITLE: An Evening at the Marina Bay Sands Skypark
REVIEW_BODY:
The MBS Skypark is an absolute must-visit if you are in Singapore. I would suggest that you choose to visit the park in the evening post 05.00 pm. That way, you can get to see the day-time views and hang around till you can picture the night-time views too.

The 360 degree city-views is worth every penny that you pay for! You can hang around at the eatery, laze around on the deck itself or book yourself a table at Ce La Vi for dinner where you can gorge on yummy food along with breath-taking views.

The skypark is worth it! So do not miss it at all.
Amazing view, very good service, and fun vibe. A must see if stopping in Singapore. Very crowded and a little chaotic, but a beautiful layout and wonderful view.

REVIEW_TITLE: An experience not to miss if you visit Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY: What an amazing view of the entire Singapore! Visit in the evening and give your eyes pleasure of lighting and night view of the entire city!

I visited this place with a friend and were wowed by this place. The view from top shows you most of beautiful singapore. We visited at night and the atmosphere and ambience great. Very friendly staff no entrance fee and no minimum table fees.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good for romantic night out with either friends or as a couple
REVIEW_BODY: Awesome. Be prepared and willing to pay for expensive drinks. It cost so much money for them to build it, let them recoup their costs if you want to enjoy the view.

REVIEW_TITLE: A good view of the city
REVIEW_BODY: Probably you can see the entire city from level 57 and the view is amazing. If you are a hotel guest, you already have access but others can purchase a ticket to go there and I would say it might be worth if you have good company and the weather's decent.

We visited about 7pm so we could experience the sunset. Amazing views all around. Great view of the night light show at the Gardens by the Bay too. Only downside was you couldn‚Äôt get a drink at the bar on the deck as it was for hotel guests only. Well worth a visit.

The Skypark is an amazing experience and we really enjoyed a couple of hours up there in the bar. But be warned it is extortionately expensive. You pay $20 each to get up there and then get a $22 drink voucher which everyone things is great but the cheapest drink is over $22. I had a Mimosa and it was $47 üò±

We enjoyed looking at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel from the window of our own hotel and then visiting the skypark to check out the view from the top. It is relatively expensive and you should check out which ticket suits you best before you go. I think we made the mistake to just get the view but I think there is another queue/ticket you can get that lets you in to the bar up the top. We couldn't access the bar with our ticket so went elsewhere for a drink rather than just stand and drink a Singapore sling from the smaller counter that had no real seating. Consequently our visit to the Skypark was relatively short. Just long enough to walk around the viewing platform and take photos of the fabulous views.
There appear to be 3 lifts, (small lifts of maybe around 10 people per lift)

I suffer from vertigo but was absolutely ok except for a few wobbly moments when I realised I was standing on the overhanging bit with no tower immediately below me.
Would recommend a trip up but again would say check which ticket you want before going.

Definitely a must on your list of things to do in Singapore. Nothing can beat the incredible view. It was very hot the day we attended so recommend taking a hat with you. Entry fees are reasonable and the queue to attend mid afternoon was very short.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic place, great view of the city
REVIEW_BODY: While staying at the hotel we had access to the Skypark, great restaurants, bar and club there, lively atmosphere.

REVIEW_TITLE: It will be great when they sort it out
REVIEW_BODY: The view is great, the area is ok, the price is too high for what you get. You get locking in on a very limited section of the deck. Very few drink or food options. The line up to leave it just absurd. It is a couple of hundred meters long after sunset. The access to bars and restaurants is completely locked of. It very limiting.

There are better places to spend your time in Singapore as this is constantly crowded, especially the pool and top floor. The selection of food and shops is not fantastic either. The only draw for me was the fantastic view of the city on the top floor.

Bottom line - constantly full of tourists, the food is mediocre and the in my opinion the only reason you should go is to savour the view from the top floor.

REVIEW_TITLE: A sheer touch of finesse and luxury
REVIEW_BODY: Located near the beach front and Merlion, it houses Hotel, shopping malls, exhibition grounds, casino and a lot more. Not at all to be missed in Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Tricky to get the best picture
REVIEW_BODY: The sky park is so huge that you really need to stay way back to take it . Impressive place , and from the top you can enjoy the view with a drink . Worth doing

Well worth the entry fee. 56 stories up overlooking the City and the Gardens by the Bay. You get two light shows, the gardens and then in the water in front of the fullerton hotel. A must do. If you can get a table at the Ce La Vi restaurant for a drink or dinner
Go for the view, a quick sunset cocktail. Very touristy, mediocre food and weak drinks. You do not get to experience the pool unless a guest.
Absolutely beautiful. From crystal decor to an inside canal with small boat rides this hotel is incredible. There is also an efficient taxi stand here.
Nice, but not as impressive as I expected. There are better places for nice views of the Singapore skyline.

If shopping or browsing is your ideal way to spend a few days..don't miss entering this magnificent building. It's very near the Gardens By The Bay and there's a lovely food mall inside. Also many, many shops.

REVIEW_TITLE: Giant rip-off if not a guest
REVIEW_BODY: 90% of the space reserved for hotel guests only. Limited views for the paying visitors running the silly green screen photo shoot in the lift queue. We visited on a weekend. Many sad and miserable looking groups parked on the floor against the outside rail blocking access to views. Far from expectations.
A wonderful view from the best place in Singapore!! Beautiful pictures that will always remind you this visit in Singapore!
This is the iconic ship shaped sky park , located on top of the Marina Bay Sands building. You can see a fountain show from the top with the Singapore‚Äôs best aerial view.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great views but over priced and dated
REVIEW_BODY: The views are amazing and was on our bucket this so glad we made it however it is super busy , dated decor and no personalised service.

My visit to this beautiful place was on my very last day. I would say, it was worth it. If you stay in the Marina Bay Sands Hotel then you should have no problem accessing the sky park or finding it. Getting to it from elsewhere, please make sure you tell the driver that you are visiting the sky park as there is a drop off for both hotel and park although you can get to it from pretty much any entrance, one puts you closer. There are signs to help you navigate to get to it. The lady at the desk/counter where we bought our tickets was very helpful. She even helped us sign up in order to get a percentage off one of our tickets. They also have staff on hand to take your photo so once you are finished with your tour, you have the option of purchasing the photo.
If you are afraid of heights, then this is definitely not for you unless you want to face those fears ‚ò∫Ô∏è
They are pretty organized so you get up and back pretty orderly and quickly. You can stay for as long as you like. No one rushes you. Once at the top though you will feel like you don't ever want yo go back down. Being at the top for me felt like you are escaping everything, but as they say" all good things must come to an end"

The views at the top are breathtaking and beautiful. So peaceful and quiet. No traffic sounds just the people around you. It's simply gorgeous. The city is so beautiful. I would go here again.
Paying to go to the observation deck is worth it because of the pictures and views you get. For free, you could reserve a table at Ce La Vie, which also has the views, although not as great.

This is a must do if ever in Singapore. We are actually staying in the hotel itself (so didn‚Äôt have to pay the $23 entry fee) but the views are amazing and you can see pretty much everything from up there. Gets quite busy after the sun goes down, so be sure to plan ahead.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great view but very expensive and crowded in the bar
REVIEW_BODY: We went to the bar on the roof at dusk so we got to see the city at daytime and also when all the lights came on. Firstly the view is fantastic. But the bar is super expensive and very crowded. There are not enough chairs for the amount of tables, something you think a hotel of this size would be able to get right. But the view was excellent.

I thought we will have more fun there. But only going up to skypark isn't as awesome. Maybe others should try sunset-time but in the day we were here, we had clouds.
Also I would recommend you to book a bar or restaurant in advance. Then I would say it is much more relaxing to stay on the roof and watch down.
To be in the pool is only allowed for hotel guests. Surely exciting, but I would not book this hotel only because of the roof.
we had a lovely timehere adults and teens rated it 10 out of 10 if you con go please do as worth a visit

Overpriced, super crowded, long wait to get an elevator down. A cattle corral experience. The views were nice but you can get just as good visiting one of the taller public housing structures and taking an elevator up to the top (google this, it's a thing!).
Also if you get motion sick, at this height the building sways a tad bit and it's not enjoyable.
We went at night and watched both the labor light show in the marina and the super tree light show in the Gardens but really wished we'd been on the ground for both of those, it was too high up and far away to get a wow affect from either.
Would not spend the money or time on this again. We did not ride the Eye but I think that would have been a better but similar experience.
Best view, delicious food and tasty cocktails. This was a great finish to our day. Plus top notch service.
Went up here in the day, the views were stunning, only issue was that it rained and there is no where to shelter up there apart from going back inside.

Whilst this had been one of the "must do's" of our visit to Singapore, we were disappointed to find that you could not view the infinity pool or dine at any of the bars or restaruants unless you were actually staying at the Hotel! And, it is not free to access, so for the cost it was a bit lacking. The views were spectacular but once again unfortunately there were no seats and we found ourselves sitting on the floor with our iced beers. Not great for visiting with elderly that need somewhere to rest.
With express elevator up to the topp floor and amasing sight eas there for you overlooking the City . Restaurant and pool there where too .

We had a short cue of six people, paid $22 Singapore dollars each and went up in the lift at Tower 3. This is the exclusive lift that takes you to the top bar. If you go to the viewing platform that's $25 SGD. The difference is there is no bar at the viewing platform, but amazing views. To go to the bar you get your $22 back via food or drink. So we get to the top with $44 SGD credit for the bar. We order the cheapest beer $16 and a Singapore sling $22 and some bar food, burger sliders $28, paying the difference. There are plenty of places to take pictures, there are two bars and you are welcome to go either side or both. There is no entrance to the pool except for guests but from one of the bars you can see the pool in all its Glory. There is not a lot of shade on the patio so take your hat or shade umbrella. Bottle if champagne starts about $130, wine is about the same. A glass or either is $30. We think it gets dearer as you go up each floor! Highly a brilliant experience. The hotel seemed really busy with guests, I am not sure about room size. There seemed to be three towers with loads of guests and lots of check in check out desks scattered around the ground floor. Well worth the experience and easy to get by bus from harbour town with bus 197. Take plenty of cash or coins because you need the correct money for the bus, it cost SGD $2.20 for two. Our day started when we went by taxi from the Marriott Tang Plaza to the sky rail, sky rail gondola costs a bit but we'll worth the ride, caught the sky rail to Sentosa and went to the Merlion, then SeaWorld, then left Sentosa by monorail to Harbour town which is free. This is a big shopping plaza with everything. We crossed the road out the front to go to the bus station to go to the Marina Bay Hotel. We saw the gardens after the Marina Bay Hotel by crossing the bridge, totally amazing. Then went back to the Hotel to catch an easy taxi at the hotel entrance back home to Marriott Tang Plaza to be spoiled. Great day.

So many people wanting to do this,it is well organised to get into the lift, both up to and back down,staff organise the queue, so no pushing or shoving. The views are sensational, but it's so crowded, and trying to get to the bar was virtually impossible. The hotel's shops are also very crowded, and that was also a little off putting, the views are sensational, but not a very pleasant experience.

REVIEW_TITLE: If you do only do one thing in Singapore, then do this!!
REVIEW_BODY: WOW WOW WOW! This place is awesome. Very easily accessed, and the entrance fee is recouped when you buy food/drink at the top. It's an amazing view from all sides. The pool is just out of this world - who wouldn't love the chance to relax and swim at 200m in the air at 8pm at night?!!

Stayed in the hotel twice in the past and just visited to give my family an impression.
I would say that any other 5 Star Hotel in Singapore would be a better choice.
The lobby is a mess, long queues and the feeling of a provincial airport.
No chance to relax by the pool with hordes of tourists walking around taking selfies.
The building is nice from a distance, that‚Äôs about it

Very crowded even just walking through the foyer. The cost was not too bad as there is a discount for being over 65. We paid for just the Observation Deck. The view from the top was breathtaking. This is certainly the spot to see the best of Singapore. Very Hot and crowded at the top. Best to go at night to see the lights of Singapore.

I wentvthere in the evening so crowded and humid so made me a bitbuncomfortable. Very close to nrt front bay station. Vto go up there you can either walk up the stairs or use lift. Avoid weekend or holidays to have good photos

REVIEW_TITLE: Only worth it from a bar, with a table, or staying in the hotel
REVIEW_BODY:
Of course it's an absolutely incredible view and very impressive - only if you're in the pool, or have a table reserved at one of the bars (which is of course, very, very expensive).

I wouldnt recommend going up just for the sake of it as the tables will be full, and you can't get to the edge to see the views. But it's beautiful for what it is, if you pay the price. I just think it's ridiculously expensive.

Went during the day great views of Singapore. Went on a Monday lines weren‚Äôt long easy to get up there and look around. Probably good views at night and to see the shows at the gardens by the Bay and marina.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great views from a fab hotel
REVIEW_BODY: Visited the Skypark and the views are fantastic, fast efficient service at a reasonable price, well worth a visit
Definitely worth paying the entrance fee to see the city landscape. The drinks are very expensive however it‚Äôs a must do in Singapore!

We paid the $20+ each to go up to the bar at night and it really wasn't worth it. Its very difficult to get a seat, but even if you do manage to get a seat you really still don't get that good a view because the deck is in the way. The very limited view we did get to see was obviously impressive (this is why I gave it a rating of 2 rather than 1, which is probably what it deserves), and it wasn't a complete waste of time, but I would recommend you do something else.

Spectacular lookout with great views of Singapore. The trip up to the sky walk level is quick and quite even though the elevator is moving very fast. Happy that it wasn‚Äôt crowded. Reasonably priced. There‚Äôs a bar/restaurant there which is a great spot to have a break. Overall worth the ticket price with unequalled views of Singapore.
This was definitely one of the things we really wanted to do whilst in Singapore and we went up at night to see the laser show. Really amazing.

REVIEW_TITLE: Get some great photographs up here!
REVIEW_BODY:
It's usually pretty busy up here. I would highly recommend not paying the entrance fee to the park (unless you're staying at the hotel and get free access), and instead go to one of the restaurants for a drink or a bite, and get the same view without the crowds.
The view is impressive and a MUST SEE while you're in Singapore.

Even with discounts for being a senior and for flying in via Singapore Airlines, it was still $S 17 to get up to the top of the "boat" skypark. It is very very open and very very hot up there. While the views all over Singapore are fabulous, it seems rather overpriced. There is nowhere to sit if one is desperate for a very overpriced drink, $S 12 for a beer, $S 15 and up for a cocktail. There is also a $S 80 for a photo, 2 postcard and 2 keyrings of the attraction. Or $S 30 for, in my case, a most awful photo. Was it worth $S 17? Would have liked it more if it was $S 10!
We had an awesome sunset experience here and could view the whole city ! We went up to the Ce La Vie to have a singapore sling and snacks and werent dissapointed !

REVIEW_TITLE: Love the Marina Bay Sands SkyPark!
REVIEW_BODY: Love the Marina Bay Sands SkyPark! Be sure to dine at Wolfgang Puck's delicious rooftop restaurant while on the roof of the Marina Bay Sands and enjoy the beautiful rooftop infinity pool! Especially beautiful at sunrise!!!
Earlier they used to let people swim in the infinity pool but not anymore but still its a place to visit and worthy of spending 1 hour easily.

The Sands complex rooftop has greart views and some nice but expensive opportunities. The developers have tried to cram too much in and whichever outlet you attend may be a bit of a disappointment as they are not connected and prices are steep.

Marina Bay Sands is a must visit architecture in Singapore. Something you can‚Äôt miss.
